channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In Myanmar’s Election, ‘Voting Out of Fear, Not Hope’
item.description: The voting for Parliament is almost sure to favor the ruling military junta, which is stage-managing the polls. Still, some see them as the most pragm...

item.title: Gen Zers and millennials flock to so-called analogs islands ‘because because so little of their life feels tangible’
item.description: "They are starting to recognize how the internet has changed their lives, and they are trying to revive these in-person, low-tech environments that ol...

item.title: Brigitte Bardot, French Movie Icon Who Renounced Stardom, Dies at 91
item.description: “And God Created Woman” made her a world-famous sex symbol in the 1950s. She later gave up acting to devote her life to animal welfare.

item.title: NASA’s upcoming moonshot may let astronauts be the first to lay eyes on parts of the lunar far side that were missed by the Apollo program
item.description: Launching early in the year, the three Americans and one Canadian will zip past the moon, do a U-turn behind it, then hustle straight back to Earth.

item.title: MacKenzie Scott’s close relationship with Toni Morrison long before Amazon put her on the path give more than $1 billion to HBCUs
item.description: Morrison, who was Scott’s mentor at Princeton University, once called the philanthropist “one of the best students I’ve ever had in my creative-writin...

item.title: Snowflake CEO: Big Tech’s grip on AI will loosen in 2026 — plus 6 more predictions that will define the year
item.description: The real AI race is starting now, and the organizations that lead in 2026 won't be those with the most AI pilots or the biggest technology budgets.

item.title: Make-Ahead Breakfast Ideas
item.description: The host of our Cooking newsletter offers a few suggestions for New Year’s Day breakfasts.

item.title: Ahead of meeting with Trump, Zelenskyy says ‘Ukraine is willing to do whatever it takes to stop this war’
item.description: Zelenskyy said the two planned to discuss security and economic agreements and he will raise “territorial issues.”

item.title: Here’s What Is in the 20-Point Peace Plan for Ukraine

item.title: Brigitte Bardot: A Life in Pictures
item.description: The movies made the French actress a star, but photography sealed her stardom.

item.title: How Cameroon Fought to Save Its Malaria Program After the U.S. Cut Critical Funding
item.description: When the Trump administration slashed foreign aid, it gutted a program that had reduced malaria deaths world wide. In northern Cameroon, health worker...

item.title: The Lure of a Rising Asian Metropolis? No Traffic.
item.description: Indonesia is building a new, green city in the jungle. Its future is far from certain, but new residents like living there.

item.title: Guinea Goes to Polls as Ruling Junta Seeks Legitimacy

item.title: What to Know About Colombia’s Role in the Global Drug Trade Amid Trump’s Feud With Petro
item.description: President Gustavo Petro is locked in a war of words with President Trump over Colombia’s major role in the global drug trade. The issue is complicated...
